channel.title: Crandor
channel.description:
[center][IMG]http://i838.photobucket.com/albums/zz305/stuartperera/devthreadlogo_zps63ea748d.png[/img][/center]
[b]Team:[/b]
[ul][li]AtomicInt_ : Ryley Kimmel[/li] [li]Clawz fury : Jason Rivera[/li] [li]RiiPiiNFtW : Stuart Perera[/li] [li]Ruzylo : Chris Ruzylo [/li][/ul]
[b]Objective:[/b] Our goal is to create a server that provides our players and community with an equal and fun experience. When I say "balance," I mean that we want to provide the skiller side of the community with fair XP rates and rate of supplies being gathered/used. For the combat side of the community, we plan on adding a completely balanced combat triangle so it can be fair to all members.
For those of you who are not familiar with the combat triangle, here is a diagram to explain:
[img]http://s3.amazonaws.com/readers/2010/01/01/cmbtriangle_1.gif[/img]
Along with balance, we plan on packing the server full of content. We plan on utilizing our mapdata (508 revision) by writing minigames for all of the minigames that were in existence during the 508 revision. We eventually plan on upgrading to 600+ maps to fill the server with even more content.
We use a git provider for maintaining necessary version control and managing our source code. If you are unfamiliar with git please read about it here: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Git_(software)
[b]What we've accomplished:[/b]
[ul][li]We have enabled RSA using 2048 bit keys.[/li] [li]A proper revision system to help determine third party clients (using protocol, similar to how Jagex initially did it)[/li] [li]Every single C2S packet has been reviewed and verified. There (should) not be any more spoofs due to unverified data being read from the client.[/li] [li]The common stream class that was ripped from the client has been rewritten with a much more safe, secure and LEGAL version.[/li] [li]The ISAAC algorithm was replaced with a much more secure, safe and LEGAL version[/li] [li]Tasks and actions that correspond to a game character have been added. Also a distanced action has been implemented to ensure that no action will be executed unless you are the proper distance away from the target.[/li] [li]HD texturing system with support for toggling between HD and SD, underlay and overlay floors are also toggle-able.[/li] [li]Most of the old shop system was rewritten, now features more safe and smooth shopping and easy to use Currency system[/li] [li]The old dialogue system has been trashed and rewritten with a more object-oriented approach in mind as well as ease of use. The new dialogue system supports all dialects from mob interaction to destroyable items.[/li] [li]Various other fixes to tons of systems around the server including but not limited to: world items, world objects, combat, trading, dueling, processing and more![/li] [li]A thread-safe derivative of Grahams task scheduler has been implemented.[/li][/ul]
We do plan on running beta once we feel comfortable with the status of the server and client as there is still work to be done!
Media:
[img]http://puu.sh/6zfPX.jpg[/img]

item.title: Crandor
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

[quote=“Scape-JAVA, post:79, topic:539199”][quote author=RiiPiiNFtW link=topic=658031.msg4406072#msg4406072 date=1392007815]

Updates on the progress right now aren’t worth posting as I am still working on cleaning up the server and client. Quite literally, its the most unorganized heap of random shit i’ve ever seen. A lot has been fixed though include reogranization, eg: packaging, and a new logger system implemented instead of the shitty Logger.log(e) under catch statements.

Cleaning the client? It’s a hardly obfuscated client.
[/quote]There is still an endless shit storm of if statements that could be turned into a ternary.

the conditional operator is only so flexible. it’s only good for short code that can be turned into even shorter concise expressions.[/quote]Yea I know. I only use it for a single if/else statement. Either way, theres more than if statements, but either way I am still working on cleaning up the shitty server mostly.

Read full topic

the conditional operator is only so flexible. it’s only good for short code that can be turned into even shorter concise expressions.

item.title: Crandor
item.dc:creator: @zuppers zuppers
item.description:
@zuppers wrote:

[quote=“RiiPiiNFtW, post:72, topic:539199”][quote author=zuppers link=topic=658031.msg4405735#msg4405735 date=1391925817]
It’s here.
[/quote]Why would it be allowed to post a link on a development team board and not here? If anything, it has more reason to be allowed on this board than that board. This board is not only for showing off work, but its the only place to post your project threads. To build anticipation for your followers who are interested in playing once the server is available. Does not make sense how after a child board split its suddenly not allowed. We’ve gotten links approved for project threads ever since i registered in 2010.[/quote]I don’t make the rules. From my immediate understanding this section’s purpose is to simply show off development. If advertising were allowed here then we would have two RS2 advertising sections.

Read full topic

We’ve gotten links approved for project threads ever since i registered in 2010.

[/quote]2) Advertising: This section is for showing off (flaunting) your work, not advertising your server and/or forums. Do so and you will be rewarded with a mute or ban.[/quote]I apologize, but either I am blind or that thread is hidden. I see one thread sticked with rules and there is nothing on links…

Excuse my idiotic eyes. I read through it for a third time and finally saw it. Either way, I don’t know why its not allowed anymore. We aren’t anything considering its just forums… We’re just asking for people to register to follow us easier as updates will primarily posted there.
